result.execSummary:
The defendant Donna B Quinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment, to the extent able.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with N.H. or J.N..  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

Defendant Donna B Quinn in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Donna B Quinn in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks or FPT/JT. Defense asks for signature bond with ELM. The State objects to modification of bond-deft allegedly participated in the delivery of heroin to a person that overdosed and the State believes that deft is also a heroin user and there is no treatment set up and lastly, this deft has been implicated in another overdose death. Although that case is still under investigation, the State believes bond is approp as set.

BTC: FPT/JT to be set. Bond modification is denied  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Ms. Johnson is ill and cannot be here. STC to be adj  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Ct 1: 961.41(1)(d)1-Manuf/Del Heroin; Ct 2: 941.30(2)-2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant, JCK.   No contact with the victim, NH (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Donna B Quinn in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Donna B Quinn in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that her family is asking for modification of bond to $500.00 along with co-signature bond. The State objects to any modification of bond.

BTC: Bond modification is granted, however, not in the amount requested. Bond to be modified to $5,000.00 cash. All terms and conditions previously ordered remain
